semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Adult and Child Abuse, Neglect and Other Maltreatment
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Chapter 19: Injury, poisoning, and certain other consequences of external causes > f. Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment

content.full_text: Sequence first the appropriate code from categories T74, Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, confirmed, or T76, Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, suspected, for abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, followed by any accompanying mental health or injury code(s). If the documentation in the medical record states abuse or neglect, it is coded as confirmed (T74.-). It is coded as suspected if it is documented as suspected (T76.-). For cases of confirmed abuse or neglect an external cause code from the assault section (X92-Y09) should be added to identify the cause of any physical injuries. A perpetrator code (Y07) should be added when the perpetrator of the abuse is known. For suspected cases of abuse or neglect, do not report external cause or perpetrator code. If a suspected case of abuse, neglect or mistreatment is ruled out during an encounter code Z04.71, Encounter for examination and observation following alleged physical adult abuse, ruled out, or code Z04.72, Encounter for examination and observation following alleged child physical abuse, ruled out, should be used, not a code from T76. If a suspected case of alleged rape or sexual abuse is ruled out during an encounter code Z04.41, Encounter for examination and observation following alleged adult rape or code Z04.42, Encounter for examination and observation following alleged child rape, should be used, not a code from T76. If a suspected case of forced sexual exploitation or forced labor exploitation is ruled out during an encounter, code Z04.81, Encounter for examination and observation of victim following forced sexual exploitation, or code Z04.82, Encounter for examination and observation of victim following forced labor exploitation, should be used, not a code from T76. See Section I.C.15. Abuse in a pregnant patient. (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L37)
content.summary: Abuse and maltreatment coding uses T74 for confirmed cases and T76 for suspected cases, with specific sequencing and external cause requirements (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L37)
key_concepts: Confirmed vs suspected abuse (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L32)
T74 and T76 categories (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L29)
External cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L32-L33)
Ruled out cases (Evidence: pg no: 85, L34-L37)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Sequence first the appropriate code from categories T74 or T76 for abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, followed by any accompanying mental health or injury code(s) (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L30)
detailed_rules.explanation: Abuse codes from T74 (confirmed) or T76 (suspected) are always sequenced first, with associated injuries and mental health conditions following (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L30)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If the documentation states abuse or neglect, it is coded as confirmed (T74.-). It is coded as suspected if documented as suspected (T76.-) (Evidence: pg no: 85, L30-L32)
detailed_rules.explanation: Documentation language determines whether to use confirmed (T74) or suspected (T76) codes based on provider's clinical assessment (Evidence: pg no: 85, L30-L32)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For cases of confirmed abuse or neglect an external cause code from the assault section (X92-Y09) should be added to identify the cause of any physical injuries (Evidence: pg no: 85, L32-L33)
detailed_rules.explanation: Confirmed abuse cases require external cause codes from assault section when physical injuries are present (Evidence: pg no: 85, L32-L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: A perpetrator code (Y07) should be added when the perpetrator of the abuse is known (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the perpetrator is identified, add appropriate Y07 code to specify relationship to victim (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For suspected cases of abuse or neglect, do not report external cause or perpetrator code (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33-L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: Suspected abuse cases (T76) should not include external cause or perpetrator codes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33-L34)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If suspected case is ruled out, use appropriate Z04 codes, not codes from T76 (Evidence: pg no: 85, L34-L37)
detailed_rules.explanation: When suspected abuse is ruled out during encounter, use specific Z04 observation codes instead of T76 codes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L34-L37)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if abuse is confirmed or suspected from documentation
Step 2: Assign appropriate T74 (confirmed) or T76 (suspected) code first
Step 3: Add codes for associated injuries and mental health conditions
Step 4: For confirmed cases with injuries, add external cause codes (X92-Y09)
Step 5: Add perpetrator code (Y07) if known for confirmed cases
Step 6: If suspected case ruled out, use Z04 codes instead

code_ranges.description: Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, confirmed (Evidence: pg no: 85, L28)
code_ranges.requirement: Use when abuse is documented as confirmed
usage_rules: Add external cause codes for physical injuries (Evidence: pg no: 85, L32-L33)
Add perpetrator codes when known (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33)

code_ranges.description: Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, suspected (Evidence: pg no: 85, L28-L29)
code_ranges.requirement: Use when abuse is documented as suspected
usage_rules: Do not add external cause or perpetrator codes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33-L34)
Use Z04 codes if ruled out (Evidence: pg no: 85, L34-L37)

code_ranges.description: Assault section external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L32-L33)
code_ranges.requirement: Use with confirmed abuse cases with physical injuries
usage_rules: Only for confirmed cases (T74) (Evidence: pg no: 85, L32-L33)
Only for confirmed cases (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33)

specific_codes.context: Use when suspected adult physical abuse is ruled out

specific_codes.description: Encounter for examination and observation following alleged child physical abuse, ruled out (Evidence: pg no: 85, L35)
specific_codes.context: Use when suspected child physical abuse is ruled out

specific_codes.context: Use when suspected adult rape is ruled out

specific_codes.context: Use when suspected child rape is ruled out

specific_codes.context: Use when suspected forced sexual exploitation is ruled out

specific_codes.description: Encounter for examination and observation of victim following forced labor exploitation (Evidence: pg no: 85, L37)
specific_codes.context: Use when suspected forced labor exploitation is ruled out

references_to.title: Abuse in a pregnant patient
references_to.explanation: Referenced for pregnancy-related abuse cases (Evidence: pg no: 85, L37)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Child presents with confirmed physical abuse by parent, has multiple bruises and fractures
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 6-year-old child with confirmed physical abuse by father, presents with multiple contusions and fractured ribs
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify confirmed abuse from documentation
Step 2: Assign T74 code for confirmed child abuse first
Step 3: Code associated injuries as secondary
Step 4: Add external cause code for assault
Step 5: Add perpetrator code for father

correct_coding.sequencing: Abuse code first, injuries second, external cause and perpetrator follow
correct_coding.rationale: Confirmed abuse sequenced first with associated injuries and external causes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L33)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot sequence injuries before abuse code
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing injuries first instead of abuse code

coding_scenarios.scenario: Adult brought for evaluation of suspected abuse, examination rules out abuse
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Adult female brought by concerned friend for evaluation of suspected domestic abuse, examination and interview rule out abuse
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify suspected abuse was ruled out
Step 2: Do not use T76 code
Step 4: Do not add external cause or perpetrator codes

correct_coding.rationale: Ruled out suspected abuse uses Z04 codes, not T76 codes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L34-L35)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use T76 when abuse is ruled out
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using T76 codes for ruled out cases

warnings: Do not use external cause or perpetrator codes for suspected cases (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33-L34)
Use Z04 codes, not T76, when suspected abuse is ruled out (Evidence: pg no: 85, L34-L37)
best_practices: Always sequence abuse codes first (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L30)
Document clearly whether abuse is confirmed or suspected (Evidence: pg no: 85, L30-L32)
Include all associated injuries and mental health conditions (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L30)
common_mistakes: Using T76 codes for ruled out cases (Evidence: pg no: 85, L34-L37)
Adding external cause codes to suspected cases (Evidence: pg no: 85, L33-L34)
Sequencing injuries before abuse codes (Evidence: pg no: 85, L27-L30)
tips: Pay attention to documentation language for confirmed vs suspected (Evidence: pg no: 85, L30-L32)
Consider pregnancy-related guidelines for pregnant patients (Evidence: pg no: 85, L37)
